title: Forced upgrades are new ... and annoying
content:
I've always chosen the Settings option to notify me about updates but let me choose to install them. Those notifications still give me the option to "dismiss," but these days ignore that and proceed to install the updates anyway. Worse, I can't even choose to restart at my convenience: The browser basically stops working until I do that, displaying the message I've attached here. (There used to be a Settings option to "Use a background service to install updates" that could be unchecked, but it's not there any more.)

This is not only obnoxious but a practical inconvenience because every time it happens I have to repopulate my Private Browsing sites. I'd hoped that there would be a fix in the latest update (that just forced itself on me) - 132.0 - but no.

Anyone else experiencing this?
creator: BlebNevus1015

title: CPU busy
content:
Hello, I have 3 PCs. One is Windows 10, Firefox 131.0.3 One is Windows 10 firefox 131.0 One is windows 11 firefox 131.0.3

All 3 PCs are running BOINC, using the remaining CPU power up to 100%

On PC W10 + FF 131.0 and PC W11 + FF131.0.3 OINC and FF share the processor time up to 100% On the PC W10 + FF 131.0.3 when FF is dispatched, nno processor time is assigned to BOINC and CPU busy is no more 100%. This situation occurs frequently and can last several minutes.

title: Eşitleme sonrası cihazlarımda yer imleri silindi
content: Bilgisayarımda ve android telefonumda firefoxu, heasbımla birlikte aktif olarak kullanıyordum ve eşitleme düzgün çalışıyordu. Ancak bilgisayara format atmak zorunda kaldım. Format sonrası firefoxu kurup hesabımla giriş yaptığımda yer imlerini eşitledi ve yer imi yöneticisinde görebildim. Ancak ne olduysa anlamadım tüm yer imlerim hesabımdan silindi ve eşitleme açık olduğu için telefonumdan da silindi malasef. Profil kısmında bilgisayarım ve telefonum aktif görünüyor ve sık sık online ve eşitlenmiş görünüyor. Hesaptan çıkıp tekrar giriş yaptığımda sorun çözülmüyor, yüklediğim eklentiler yükleniyor ancak yer imleri geri gelmiyor. Forumlarda söylenen birkaç yolu denedim ama çözüm olmadı. Bu yer imlerinin online bir yedeği yok mudur veya sabit disk üzerinden kurtarmanın başka yolu yokmudur? Yardım bekliyorum.
creator: serhat.vurgun41

title: Open downloaded images do not get focus
content: Using latest Firefox version (132.0) on Windows 10. For a few days now, something weird is happening with my Firefox. On browsing the internet with an image on a page and I right-click and save it, it gets properly saved to my downloads folder. Then, on Firefox, when I click on the downloads button and pick the just downloaded image, it opens the app with the image (in my case, irfanview), but the iview window does not get focus, it stays behind the Firefox window. If I click on the iview window on the taskbar, or minimize the Firefox window, I can see the image, the iview window is not minimized or anything. The problem is definitely with Firefox. I went to Windows settings, changed the image handling app to Windows Photos and the same thing happened. I have disabled all Firefox extensions and the issue still surfaces. Same thing if I start a new Firefox private window, so I am clueless as what is causing this. Even more puzzling, the problem only happens with images, PDF files, for example, open fine and Adobe Reader window gets focus and I can see the file right away. Tried to create a new Firefox profile, just in case, and I have the same problem. What changed since this was working fine? Just Firefox and Windows updates, nothing else changed, I didn't touch Firefox settings at all. Any ideas? Thanks for your help.
creator: jcpinto0

title: No Longer Able to Print Emails (Gmail and AOL) or Save Them as PDF (works in other browsers; doesn't work in safemode either)
content:
I've never had this issue before, but as of this evening I am no longer able to Print Emails in Firefox. I can't print them to a physical printer nor save them as PDF. Once I select to print an email the "Preparing Preview" page loads, but then get stuck.

This happens even in Firefox Safe Mode.

This happens with any email client - happens with Gmail and with AOL email accounts.

I have no problems printing these same emails in Google Chrome browser.

In addition, if I follow Firefox's steps to "Clear saved print settings" the problem is solved for only a single printing before reverting to getting stuck again.

Any help is greatly appreciated. I have no idea how to get around this issue. I need to save multiple emails as PDF files and physically print them every day. This issue makes Firefox unusable to me.
creator: LK85

title: Opening Tabs By Itself
content: Honestly, I feel that this is more of a security question, but this is what happened: I had locked my laptop and walked away for a few hours. When I came back, Firefox had closed two of my tabs and opened three new ones, 2 of which were youtube videos that were playing music while my computer was locked. All of the tabs were centered around a gif that I looked up using a chat site's tenor keyboard and never actually sent. Why in the world did my locked laptop have a bunch of random tabs open? How do I stop this from happening in the future so I don't have to switch browsers? I did not like coming home to this at all. I ran a virus scan, but the only thing on my computer that was off was Firefox itself, so that's why I'm asking. This has never happened before, but I had to reinstall this browser a couple days ago so I'm wondering if there's some sort of bug or something that came with the new install. Please ease my mind about this.
creator: loseyourhands
